qas.question: As an inhaler, what was epinephrine used to treat?
Who developed the method to obtain epinephrine in a pure state?
When did epinephrine stop being available in the United States?
What trade name was epinephrine marketed under?
Who developed the method to get epinephrine in it's pure form?
In what year was epinephrine discovered?
What was the trade name of epinephrine?
What is epinephrine used to treat?
In what year was Primatene Mist no longer sold in the United States?
What trade name was Primatene marketed under?

context: By the 1890s the profound effect of adrenal extracts on many different tissue types had been discovered, setting off a search both for the mechanism of chemical signalling and efforts to exploit these observations for the development of new drugs. The blood pressure raising and vasoconstrictive effects of adrenal extracts were of particular interest to surgeons as hemostatic agents and as treatment for shock, and a number of companies developed products based on adrenal extracts containing varying purities of the active substance. In <a8_0>1897<a8_0/> <a0_0><a10_0><b13_0>John Abel<b13_0/><a10_0/><a0_0/> of Johns Hopkins University identified the active principle as epinephrine, which he isolated in an impure state as the sulfate salt. Industrial chemist <a3_0><a7_0><b17_0>Jokichi Takamine<b17_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/> later developed a method for obtaining epinephrine in a pure state, and licensed the technology to <b14_0>Parke Davis<b14_0/>. <a1_0>Parke Davis<a1_0/> marketed epinephrine under the trade name <a6_0><a9_0><b15_0>Adrenalin<b15_0/><a9_0/><a6_0/>. Injected epinephrine proved to be especially efficacious for the acute treatment of <a11_0>asthma attacks<a11_0/>, and an inhaled version was sold in the United States until <a5_0><a12_0>2011<a12_0/><a5_0/> (Primatene Mist). By 1929 epinephrine had been formulated into an inhaler for use in the treatment of <a2_0><a4_0><b16_0>nasal congestion<b16_0/><a4_0/><a2_0/>.
